author: cnbc.com
title: Xperi posts 4Q profit
text:
SAN JOSE, Calif. (AP) _ Xperi Corp. (XPER) on Tuesday reported fourth-quarter net income of $5.6 million, after reporting a loss in the same period a year earlier.
On a per-share basis, the San Jose, California-based company said it had profit of 11 cents. Earnings, adjusted for amortization costs and non-recurring costs, were 77 cents per share.
The provider of chip technology for small electronic devices posted revenue of $126.6 million in the period.
For the year, the company reported a loss of $56.6 million, or $1.15 per share, swinging to a loss in the period. Revenue was reported as $373.7 million.
Xperi shares have dropped 14 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Tuesday, shares hit $20.90, a decline of 52 percent in the last 12 months.
